trustfund:
TF026886-JSDF-LAO PDR: VILLAGE
            INVESTMENT FOR THE POOR PROJECT,TF026179-PHRD-AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT
            PROJECT (BANK-EXECUTED),TF026194-PHRD-AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT
            PROJECT (RECIPIENT-EXECUTED)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Development Project
            aims to reduce rural poverty by improving and increasing
            agricultural production through a community-based approach
            in designing and implementing components which directly
            impact the lives of the poor in the participating provinces
            and districts. There are six components in this project. The
            first component will improve rural infrastructure by
            supporting the rehabilitation of small-scale irrigation
            systems, the rehabilitation of rural access tracks and
            trails, and the improvement of rural water supply and
            sanitation. The second component, Village Investment for the
            Poor, will be a block grant allocated to a district for
            implementing small scale projects identified by the
            villagers themselves. The third component, Improved
            Agricultural Services, will provide for: a) institutional
            strengthening of agricultural services at district,
            provincial, and central levels for the delivery of extension
            services; and b) adaptive research and demonstrations. The
            fourth component will support the policy of transferring
            responsibility for irrigation management and system to water
            user associations. The fifth component, environmental
            management, will finance activities for raising awareness
            among farmers and extension staff of environmental issues.
            The sixth component sill provide support for the
            implementation and coordination units, and in particular
            strengthen capacity in monitoring and evaluation as well as
            in financial management.
